website_summaries.verdict: The Asus C200 Chromebook has a new Intel processor and 802.11ac Wi-Fi for fast, robust Web connectivity. It's a solid basic computer for those who prefer the laptop form factor to tablets.
cons: Screen has narrower viewing angle than an In-Plane Switching (IPS) display

customer_reviews.title: Great screen and good keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great screen, reasonably lightweight, decent performance, stellar battery life (10 hours approx.) particularly good keyboard, plastic finish but feels ok. Also a plus that it comes with free airplane wifi passes, 2 months of Google Music and free Google Drive storage. Personally, I really like my other Chromebook (the HP Chromebook 14) with built in LTE since I can use it from anywhere, but this has a better screen and is more portable (ironically, since it does have LTE). Of course it's a Chromebook, so it books fast and is great for certain tasks but lacks Skype and full office, though the web version of Office is getting better for basic edits.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comparing with Acer C720
customer_reviews.text: I had a chance to compare Acer C720 side by side with this Asus C200 chromebook. I have a different take on Bay Trail N2830 processor vs Haswell 2955U. To me it looks, Bay Trail is slightly faster than 2955U, for tasks like loading a javascript intensive web page, viewing youtube video etc. The build quality of this chromebook is much better than the Acer. Wonderful keyboard and tracking pad, good smooth display for watching videos. Also, Acer C720 had some reliability issues like trackpad won't work while charging. Decided to keep the Asus and returning the Acer C720.
customer_reviews.author: Karthik

customer_reviews.title: Superb for light use
customer_reviews.text: For its price, this is an amazing computer. What I love most: it weighs nothing, and the battery lasts forever. Boots up instantly. If I go on a weekend trip, I don't even bother packing the charger. Sound and video are excellent. For light web-browsing on-the-go, it can't be beat. With Google Docs it's handy for homework or office tasks. That said, for more involved tasks this machine is severely under-powered. Open too many tabs and some will crash due to memory exhaustion. Complicated web pages will get it bogged down. It has a built-in SD card reader, but don't even think of using it to view photos from your camera.
customer_reviews.author: T. Fricke

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: arrived early and works great! had it a couple weeks. so glad I got it for the price. well worth it so far. my first chromebook lasted 4 years, so even tho chromebooks lack a bunch of abilities and features, it was super crash free & lasted a long time so I got a chromebook this time again just to maximize the value until I can get a fully functioning laptop.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: Good build quality, no problems
customer_reviews.text: We replaced a beaten-up Acer 710 and are very happy with our purchase. It's just about a perfect size, it boots up quickly, rarely drags, hangs, or annoys. We'll probably always have a "real" laptop with a Windows OS, but I find myself using such a beast less and less, at home at least. There were other competitive products. I'm sure they're decent, and I thought long and hard about re-upping with Acer; but I've been impressed with Asus' quality in some other devices that I've used (tablets, Windows laptops) and this 200-dollar product is very solidly built.
customer_reviews.author: Dirk

customer_reviews.title: Much more useful than I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.text: I was dubious after reading all the internet squawk claiming Chromebooks are only good for surfing... That's not quite true. It actually does stuff and there are a bajillion apps out there that work offline. It's fast and easy. I expected a super dumbed down function-free version of Ubuntu but was surprised by both the machine and the OS. I actually bought it for my wife who is not at all tech savvy but she does like to surf. After configuring it for her I of course had to take it for a test drive. I'm secretly hoping she'll hate it so I can have it but so far she likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good for typing, researching, etc. NOT high-end activities.
customer_reviews.text: I really, really enjoy the ease of portability on my Chromebook - but there are some things it lacks (which does not reflect Amazon.) You wont know pain until you've tried editing an excel document then sending it back to a client, to have them reject it time and time again because you need to figure out how to export it. This is true for everything - Word files, Excel, etc and it's not uniform across the board. I wish it saved in original format, however this is not the case. If what you are looking for is an inexpensive, speedy small laptop that is easy to lug around then this is the machine for you.
customer_reviews.author: The Vanilla Gorilla

customer_reviews.title: I loved my first one
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Chromebook. I loved my first one, and when it died I decided to buy this one. I loved it at first, even though the hardware was clearly cheaper than my first one. No big deal, you get what you pay for. The problem is that after two months of use, the track pad is pretty much useless. I can still use it to click on things, but the drag function is dead, making it very difficult to copy/paste, play games, or move files around. Now I'm looking at buying another laptop, even though I love the Chrome OS.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Has everything I need. Does everything I want except...
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I bought this Chromebook to temporarily replace my $1,400 17-inch Asus N71JQ, which is now a giant paper weight with a burned-out motherboard - at least it smells like it. After using this little baby for one day, I'm in no rush to get big brother fixed. Boot-up speed, keyboard size, computer size and weight...I love everything about it. UPDATE: The following day, the touchpad started having some issues. The push-to-click function stopped being responsive when I clicked on a URL or items on the Taskbar, for example. I'd have to push it hard and long to get it to work. Note: the tap-to-click is perfect. I'll get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Nobrun

customer_reviews.title: easily portable and seems sturdier than the previous one we ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for the little learner. This is replacing an Acer chrome book which gave great-reliable service for 3+ years, but broke due to an accident, simply a human error. So we were looking for a sturdier book. Here is what we feel: This Asus C200 11.6 inch chrome book is light weight, easily portable and seems sturdier than the previous one we had. Battery life is great. Key board spacing is comfortable for a kid as well as adults. Screen is well built, but image/video quality is average. Works fine with 4-5 tabs open. A decent pick for the price and its intended use.
customer_reviews.author: SumanS

customer_reviews.title: Great touchpad and keyboard on a good chromebook
customer_reviews.text: One of the better chromebooks. Its touchpad is top notch and works without weird lag that I occasionally noticed on the original samsung chromebook. The screen looks great head on, but vertical viewing angles are poor. The keyboard seems to be full sized or close enough that I cant tell the difference. For the price, you get a very functional device that can play videos from our class's lecture software with no problem. Pathoma also works with no issues. Its long battery life, and good keyboard makes this a good laptop for a student. I recommend pairing with a samsung note tablet to take notes. You can get both this and a tablet for less than some laptops.
customer_reviews.author: Sid

customer_reviews.title: goodbye microsoft !
customer_reviews.text: i hate windows & i hate microsoft ! this is just like your smartphone or tablet . type your password in and you're on google its that easy . took me 5 min. to set up . if you use a pc for work or use windows this is not for you . if you like surfing the web ,emails ,apps and google buy it ! thumbs up to amazon ,google and asus ! oh yeh dont buy a $200 16gb & 2gb ram pc and and think it will do what a $1200 mac 12-inch will and then leave a bad review . im cheap not stupid !
customer_reviews.author: MR. GREEN

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a close younger relative. She has had no problems and it worked completely as expected, being a great aid in her schoolwork and entertainment. It was delivered on time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I was majorly skeptic about buying something that wasn't a "real computer" but this chromebook is a lifesaver. It's light. Battery life is f-ing brilliant. It's a bit wobbly on a flat surface but since I use it for travel and prop it on my lap, it works fine. I def. recommend this product. After reading the reviews, I'm a bit worried about warranty and what if I needed it service, though! =/ I've had it for about 6 months so far.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kaur

customer_reviews.title: My New Best Friend
customer_reviews.text: It's a great little toy. It's light as a feather so I drag it around all day. The battery lasts forever and it recharges very quickly. It makes blogging so easy. Now I just have to figure out how to send things to the cloud for printing on my new wireless printer. That hasn't been much fun to figure out. The online directions are confusing. I'm glad I still have my old laptop or I'd be in trouble. I'd have given it 5 stars if it came already able to "talk" to printers without all that confusing registering business.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kendall

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need
customer_reviews.text: For the record, I bought this solely so I could type at home and be able to access the internet. I was a little disappointed that it didn't have basic programs like microsoft word installed, but google docs has everything so I wasn't too concerned. It's also a bit of a bummer that it can't be used to watch DVDs, but when you get something that lightweight I guess that function can't really be expected. Overall I'm pleased with this device. It does what I need, runs well, and is super light weight.
customer_reviews.author: roygbv

customer_reviews.title: Thinking about a Chromebook? Get it. Get this one.
customer_reviews.text: If your are looking for a small, light, EXTREME battery, productivity laptop, this guy is great. Of course it is Chromebook and doesn't support windows, mac or linux applications... oh but wait. It CAN support linux applications. I can run Linux from within Chrome by simply typing sudo startxfce4 (after doing the install process, there are plenty of guides) and I can run linux applications for much more functionality! It runs linux VERY smoothly with no noticeable hangups. I use it for GIMP and programming my cisco routers and switches at home.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dicus

customer_reviews.title: Great Second Computer
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a secondary notebook for some web browsing, e-mail, watching videos, and other simple tasks. Decided to get a Chromebook and selected Asus C200 do to the small form factor and good price. The speed is fine for these types of tasks. Its nice and light at only 2.5 pounds. Keyboard is a decent size and has a good feel. The track pad works well. Good sound from the speakers. Very pleased with it and it fits my needs without dealing with Windows. Chrome OS is a nice lightweight OS that works well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Dean

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: So far this device has been great. After just over a month of owning it there are only 2 issues that keep me from giving it a 5 star rating: The lack of a button to easily right click, trying to use the touchpad to open a right click accessible menu is hit or miss and rather frustrating. Google Drive crashes randomly for no apparent reason even when not currently in use. Aside from these issues the Chromebook works well and has great battery life.
customer_reviews.author: J. B. Fox

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: The only thing i did not like was that i had to switch from open office to a new writing program. It did have an open office app but it tended to lag while writing. One you get used to Google docs though it's great. The surfing is snappy and all the controls are a breeze to understand and utilize. I haven't tried playing any apps on it but for surfing, writing, emailing, etc (basic functions) it's a great little computer. Battery last a long time, starts up/shuts down quick.
customer_reviews.author: Comsumerist2019

customer_reviews.title: A really great product!
customer_reviews.text: I love my little chromebook! It operates quickly and is a great size to carry around with me when heading to class. As a college student I try to pack light when walking around a large campus. This chromebook has made it possible for me to leave my heavy macbook pro at home and just take this with me. I also have an android phone that works wonderfully with the chromebook. ASUS did a great job. It is high quality and could EASILY function as a fulltime laptop for someone that does not need a disk drive! Love this chromebook!
customer_reviews.author: Maryalice

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 2 years, then a slow painful death.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this laptop 2 1/2 years ago. It worked great for about two years. the last six months it has run slow, and would occasionally shutdown during use. one month ago it completely failed. I got it to come back to life with help from people on the google forums, but it failed again yesterday and won't even turn on. I am not sure the expected life for a chrome book, but when I only used it for internet surfing and and email, I would have expected longer than 2.5 years.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: and this one is the finest I have owned (although I never had one of ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had several Chromebooks over the years, and this one is the finest I have owned (although I never had one of those Acer Haswell units). I have now had the unit for a couple of months, and all is good. It is extremely portable. Plenty of power to keep 5-6 tabs open and working at all times. Wifi seems sturdy. Screen is good. Battery is incredible. Work all day at the cafe without worrying about a plug.
customer_reviews.author: Rex Koontz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for school use
customer_reviews.text: I love this chromebook. I use it for college classes since the battery lasts so long, it is completely quiet, and never gets hot. Others have had issues with the charger but I have not had any problems, it also recharges the battery much faster than what others had been saying. I have not had any issues with it being slow either. I typically have about 8 tabs open at once but I do not play online games on it or do any sort of picture/video editing. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: HailtotheVictors

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy! Great battery life and it's so light!
customer_reviews.text: Loving my new chromebook so far! My macbook pro from when I was in college is effectively dead since the battery swelled up. It cost $130 to replace the battery, so I figured rather than do that I'd invest that same money in the chrome book. So glad I did! The battery life is superb, I like to watch shows on my laptop while cooking or cleaning in the kitchen and it's so cool that I don't have to run and grab the charger.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Crap! ChromeOS is crap, Google Support is crap
customer_reviews.text: I loved it when I first got it but then the WiFi issues popped up - there are 1000s of users reporting similar WiFi issues with ChromeOS - not just this model. I'm lucky if this piece of junk can stay on any WiFi network for more than five minutes. I've called Google for support and they are all like - reboot or power-cycle the router. Yea, I'll ask every coffee house or hotel or business I go to "please reboot the router cause Google don't know how to manage a WiFi connection" - or use my Lenovo with Linux. I've given this crap away, glad to be rid of the headache. How could a simple machine be so frustrating?
customer_reviews.author: edoceo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing price for a great product
customer_reviews.text: The Chromebook is the way to go if you are sick and tired of getting viruses. It is super fast and doesn't take forever to boot up like conventional computers. This is the way to go. The price is amazing and so far I am extremely impressed. I wish I would have gone this route years ago. Thanks Google for making such an awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M. Geraci

customer_reviews.title: Just what i needed
customer_reviews.text: i love this. As a single (broke) mom, this chromebrook was exactly what I needed. I used to use my iPhone for everything which made some things on the web a bit of a challenge. This meets all my needs, connects quickly and all the Google apps are easy to learn and navigate. And of course- the price. Sooo glad I didn't end up having to go to WalMart for a cheap laptop.
customer_reviews.author: BoltSkinz

customer_reviews.title: Extremely pleased with this little ASUS Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: Extremely pleased with this little ASUS Chromebook. I am a web developer with a Computer Science background (IT), I love this notebook because 1) its ultra lightweight -take it anywhere. 2) turns on like a light switch, browses the web, writes emails...runs applications at lightspeed... 3) it was darn cheap!! 4) display and keyboard are very nice... 5) very long battery life... 6) its just darn convenient
customer_reviews.author: JT145

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 would buy again
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little surfboard. I bought this for taking notes and conferences and surfing the web and it excels at both. You cannot do anything too serious and it would be useless without an internet connection, but for the majority of what I am doing on the internet this is perfect and the batter seems to just go on forever... even after a full day of notes I have half a charge to go.
customer_reviews.author: Overweight Kenobi

customer_reviews.title: It's nice I love the long battery life and super fast ...
customer_reviews.text: It's nice I love the long battery life and super fast charging, Only thing I don;t like is because I did not know anything about Chromebook I can't do alot on here like I can with a windows laptop. If your just wanting to play around on internet or simple stuff then it's great if your can figure it out your better than me, Still cant get my printer hooked up and I can't download coupons to print that way my main reason for getting it,
customer_reviews.author: Sheri H Smith

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Tried several android and chrome laptops but found the ASUS to be the best for me. Love the simplicity of the operating system, rapid loading of files and auto updates. Boots in seconds!! I am hoping that Chrome OS will one day have the ability to play DVD's which is the only negative I have thus far. Would definitely but again!
customer_reviews.author: David L. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the Acer C720
customer_reviews.text: Although the OS is somewhat annoying because they don't let you make decisions you should have 100% control over, this computer is much better than the Acer C720. If you're debating between the two, this is the one you want. Now if Google will quit forcing me to enter my complicated Google password every time I start the computer and let me download Skype, I would rate it 5 stars. ASUS = 5 stars Google = 2 stars
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little chromebook!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, this was my first Chromebook so I can't really compare to the others. I love the look and feel of this laptop it's battery life is great, I can usually go about 2-3 days on a single charge. I haven't experienced any issues with lag or stuttering. I think as long as you use this machine as it was intended to be used (as a secondary device and not a desktop replacement) I think anyone will just as happy as I am. Well done ASUS!!!
customer_reviews.author: C. Manrique

customer_reviews.title: I contacted Amazon and after a quick easy call, a new one was overnighted to me
customer_reviews.text: The first one I ordered had a problem with the charging port. I contacted Amazon and after a quick easy call, a new one was overnighted to me, and I returned the defective one. This was for my daughter to use for school and she loves it. It works fast, plays a lot of apps, and is very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: I researched the google chrome OS and felt cautiously satisfied. We have been using the system for about ...
customer_reviews.text: I researched the google chrome OS and felt cautiously satisfied. We have been using the system for about a month for web-browsing mostly. We don't need it for printing or photo-editing (although photo-editing should work fine, depending on the program.) Short answer, my husband finds it very easy to use and he is very happy with it. So am I. I have an "older" MacBook Pro" and the new Chromebook works as well or better for what we are using it for. We are quite pleased.
customer_reviews.author: MA Nusbaum

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for browsing
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for use when traveling. Perfect size for browsing, e-books and other computing needs while on the road. The kindle cloud app allows me to download e-books from my local library while traveling. The reduced keyboard takes a little getting used to but all in all a very satisfying purchase and value.
customer_reviews.author: old cycler

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop for a cheap price
customer_reviews.text: Great laptop for a cheap price. If you're worried about space, insert and SD card. I installed Gallium OS so I have a full linux desktop and I'm not limited by the Chrome OS environment and their apps. I even installed steam to play games with lower graphics requirements.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great little Chromebook for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Great little Chromebook for what I needed. I have a high powered CPU tower to do any serious computing. I wanted something small and inexpensive to browse the web and write rough drafts of my college papers at local coffee shops. This little guy does the trick. Feels very nice and of good build quality. Yes, you have to reformat a rough draft written in Google docs through Word for formal college assignments, but it doesn't take that long to reformat on a computer with Office Suite. This is a great secondary computer to supplement my high powered CPU on the go.
customer_reviews.author: jon schroeder

customer_reviews.title: we loved it, worked so well
customer_reviews.text: Its a shame, I bought this Chromebook for my wife, we loved it, worked so well,that my mom, my sister and my neice bought the newer version of this Chromebook. After 11 months the battery died, now it only worked pluged in. Other than that, it is a great device.
customer_reviews.author: Philippe Quillery

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Wow so much more than a tablet for less money. I have a tablet that I still use for books and some tablet based streaming but this Chromebook is so much faster than my Windows laptop for everything else. I hooked up a 2T drive with all my movies to the USB port and watch on my TV by either Tab casting to my Chromecast or the HDMI connection. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: john watters

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I like the long battery life
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I like the long battery life, very light, silent, different profiles for different users and guest profile the doesn't save any history. Keyboard is good and the touch pad is pretty easy to use also. It uses two fingers to right click which takes a little getting used. Sometimes you ended clicking instead of right clicking.
customer_reviews.author: Brando

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This item is complete trash the webcam dont work the frame of the laptop is is horrible condition and there is 3 huge white spot in the middle of the screen. Plus it will not work unless it is in charge. I have tried contacting the seller for a refund but they refuse to answer me. My advice is to save your money and look else where
customer_reviews.author: Jack sneed

customer_reviews.title: Awesome small portable lightweight computer!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome computer! Small, portable, lightweight, and fast. Great for any on the go computing (Checking e-mails, handling finances, playing music, and streaming videos). I carry it with me when I bike to work. The battery lasts about 10 hours. It never gets hot. No moving parts so it seems like it's going to last a while. I highly recommend installing a linux distro on it if you want to work offline. This little thing runs really well I was able to stream videos from youtube and flawlessly play @ 1080p using the HDMI port. Great for on-the-go computing. Not for graphic design or video games.
customer_reviews.author: Marlo Villanueva

customer_reviews.title: ASUS knocked it out of the park!
customer_reviews.text: 12+ hours of battery life and only 2.5 lbs, this Chromebook is amazing. I love the keyboard, trackpad is pretty good. My only complaint is the narrow vertical viewing angle and top shell that captures fingerprints like i'm eating fried chicken. At $245 this is a bargain, great for all day use and lightweight enough that I want to take it everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph E Dickson

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife, she loves it . It was easy to set up, well built, and no more waiting 10 min. for windows to load up on her laptop. Also no more freeze ups. So far battery life has been very good. Great for the person that only does facebook and checks their mail and googles. Video plays great. Light and very slim line., well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: The built-in SD slot and the USB 3 ports make this perfect for file transfers
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly versatile little notebook. I took it on an extended backpacking trip and used it to copy photos from my cameras onto portable drives and the cloud. The built-in SD slot and the USB 3 ports make this perfect for file transfers. Good connectivity and a lot of nice freebies (cloud storage, Gogo Mobile, etc).
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: I really like this for its portability
customer_reviews.text: I really like this for its portability, long battery life, and quick start-up. I bought mine 6 months ago, and it still works fine. I find going between this at home and a large screen dual-monitor set-up at work occasionally frustrating, but I really can accomplish everything I need to at home on this. Unfortunately, our cat chewed through my charge cord, and I'm not sure how/where to find another that will fit it. (We got my husband an ASUS Chromebook that is nearly identical, but it has a completely different power jack.)
customer_reviews.author: jcg

customer_reviews.title: ... this a week or so now and so far good. Its light weight and easy to move around
customer_reviews.text: I've had this a week or so now and so far good. Its light weight and easy to move around, it charges quickly and lasts a while. It starts up easily. The only problem I saw was that when I plug in my headphones I sometimes have to restart the laptop, but other than that it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Meghin Otillia

customer_reviews.title: Recommended. Look it up yourself.
customer_reviews.text: Simple yet great value. Amazingly light. HDMI , one 3 and one 2 usb ports. Insane battery life. Touch pad is large too. High quality audio and screen with camera and mic. More too learn for me. However I was able as a non computer geek 41 yrs old to get going right away. VALUE!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: Amazing laptop for simple tasks, like web browsing and netflix watching. No disk drive, which is no problem. Runs smoothly, lightening fast and beautifully silent. Only downfall is it's not compatible with Skype. That was my only surprise but it isn't a huge factor to me. I adore this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: You can't beat the value of this machine for $170-190
customer_reviews.text: This of this as a tablet with a super keyboard. The battery life is amazing - about 7-10 hours. If I bought again I might go for the 4gb in RAM ; but 2gb is fine 85% of the time only issue is when trying to stream espn radio / and something else 'heavy' (for me it was the dough trading platform)
customer_reviews.author: Richard Bowles

customer_reviews.title: First Chromebook. Like it.
customer_reviews.text: Never had Chromebook before but so far, I like it. Of course, I'll keep my Windows-based machines because of the the functionality of them but this Chromebook is light, sturdy and nice. I like the quick start and quickness of the machine. I will get an SD card though for extra storage because I don't like the idea of everything resting in the cloud. A bit too small screen for continual viewing but I like it. Plays mp3s with decent sound. Will be very nice for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Billtown

customer_reviews.title: Always check to make sure things are fine with the laptop
customer_reviews.text: I bought it months ago so I could use it during my classes to take notes and just mess around during break time in between my classes. The laptop that I was given did not even start at all when I got it but it started working when i plugged in the charger guessing it wasn't charged. But later on when i took it to school after thinking it was fully charged when i left it charging late at night I came to realize that there was a battery problem with the laptop so i returned it and got my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Zullard

customer_reviews.title: Really excellent battery life
customer_reviews.text: Really excellent battery life. I charge it overnight, and can take it all day and use it constantly without worrying about it powering down. So i don't even take the charger with me. Works great as long as you know what it's good for - and you're not trying to make it be a full on computer.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Burr

customer_reviews.title: very good screen - nice touch on keyboard - AMAZING batt ...
customer_reviews.text: I have switched to Chromebooks after Macs. Last one crashed at 3 yrs [Samsung that survived falling of car roof onto pavement at 10 mph]. New one booted up and everything was there. Did not lose anything - thanks Google. very good screen - nice touch on keyboard - AMAZING batt life - love Chromecast.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: I have had an acer ten inch for five years, just got this ASUS Chromebook today and WOW do I love it already! It's sooo easy to set up too. I'm 66 on Tuesday and away we goooo. LOVE IT! What a deal for $199. and our tech wizard daughter recommended this one to us. We thank her!
customer_reviews.author: yarvet

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, as far as chromebooks go.
customer_reviews.text: This is David. This is an awesome chromebook, as far as chromebooks go. It is the newest, so it is even probably the best. The screen is bright, the sound is awesome, it looks like a macbook on the inside, and it's fast. The only problems are the very occasional mouse glitch and the glossy (fingerprint magnet) screen. But these problems are trivial and I don't care too much. And for $250? Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: 6 In is without a doubt NOT the greatest chromebook for your money
customer_reviews.text: Asus C200 Chrombook 11.6 In is without a doubt NOT the greatest chromebook for your money. It works perfect for me as a student who needed an inexpensive laptop to haul around without the worry that my Toshiba laptop implements. It is best used as a casual/business type of device, as I use it for more security type reasons for many purchases, job applications, etc. I am getting a powerhouse of a PC that I will be using this device in conjunction with and recommend this to anyone looking for a little laptop for web use, and pretty much anything related to the web.
customer_reviews.author: Armand

customer_reviews.title: The absolute best entry level Chromebook for young students!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best entry level Chromebooks available for a student. The performance is wonderful and the battery life is 10-11 hours as advertised. The laptop is very sturdy and the screen is very enjoyable to view. The long battery life really sells this considering how much it is used. Impossible to find better for the money. Five stars all the way!
customer_reviews.author: Seth B

customer_reviews.title: not happy with the cloud
customer_reviews.text: the device is ok, not happy with the cloud drive Update; The device crashed within under a year after purchase. I attempted to recover several times with an ASUS program with negative results. It's home now is in the junk pile in my office. Bad bad purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RDA

customer_reviews.title: Lotta' bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great computer for me and the things I do, such as, browsing the internet and checking e-mail. I love that it "turns on" as soon as you open it.I now use this chromebook exclusively instead of my computer except when I need to print something.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Barton

customer_reviews.title: got duped!!🤨
customer_reviews.text: This was a horrible buy!! The seller should be ashamed of themself. This computer worked for about 30 days and then the screen started fluttering and went completely out! total bs!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Kieffer

customer_reviews.title: Nice buy!
customer_reviews.text: Nice buy!....getting used to utilizing the MS office software on my Google Chrome, Great for school, fast & lightweight! Wanted a new IPad Air but this is way more affordable...& I'm not a fan of the RT Surfaces, Wimdows 8'sucks.....a Google Chrome worked out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: This is a chrome book. It’s not like any other laptop. Very unique
customer_reviews.text: It’s lasted me a few years! It still works like new.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Borden

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Chromebook is still going strong. Good product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: miss some of the benefits and easy steps as windows has
customer_reviews.text: i've had this for a year.. this will be the last Chromebook i buy.. its definantly not windows... miss some of the benefits and easy steps as windows has.. its been a good computer.. no issues.. its light weight.. does most what i need.. just the apps and saving files is difficult..
customer_reviews.author: cindy hunsinger

customer_reviews.title: it's good. However
customer_reviews.text: I found this Chromebook to be acceptable for its price. It does what it needs to do. I bought this product with the intention of using Google Docs and checking email while I'm on the road for work, and for that purpose, it's good. However, I wouldn't expect more from this tier of laptop. One con after about a year of use: The left click button has become very responsive. I have to push it very hard for a click to register. I've adapted to tapping the track pad instead, but this is the reason I'm giving this notebook 4 stars instead of 5.
customer_reviews.author: WS

customer_reviews.title: Why would anyone buy a tablet . .
customer_reviews.text: . . When they can get on of these at a fraction of the cost. What I like the best is the spaced keyboard! I wish I could find a standard keyboard built the same way. Perfect for us guys with gorilla paws!
customer_reviews.author: Mister C

customer_reviews.title: this chrome book is perfect for that with its lightweight body and Google docs
customer_reviews.text: I must say this little chrome book get the job done, that is if you need it for classic web browsing,work and entertainment. Not much to it but with enough features. I manage a restaurant and have to make schedules and documents, this chrome book is perfect for that with its lightweight body and Google docs. This is a great computer that runs all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Ramon Ordaz

customer_reviews.title: LOVE This!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE it! It works perfectly! We have 3, my 2 sons (13 & 11) each have their own, which is perfect, they use it for school work. It's fast processing, downloading is really fast.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly G

customer_reviews.title: Great chromebook
customer_reviews.text: I love this chromebook, it is fast, the battery life is great and overall I would give it a 10 plus. The volume is also really good. I find nothing negative about this Chromebook whatsoever. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Shopgirl

customer_reviews.title: For something simple, it works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a lightweight computer to carry around with me and if that's what you're looking for I highly recommend this Chrome book. It does only run Chrome, but through google docs you can work on documents offline as well. I love that it has a usb port, that's what was lacking with my tablet (as well as a real keyboard). It's simple, but it runs fast enough and does it's job. (note: I've had the computer for 3 weeks so far)
customer_reviews.author: shs

customer_reviews.title: This little laptop is amazing. It's fast
customer_reviews.text: This little laptop is amazing. It's fast, not at all "glitchy", I switched to chrome. My $1500.00 Dell XPS is sitting in the closet.
customer_reviews.author: Goff

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little chrome book
customer_reviews.text: Awesome chrome book. Got it at a great price too. Swift shipping in box. No damage and perfect little machine for the easy stuff
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly good product at a very good price
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly good product at a very good price. It isn't a full computer by any means, but I didn't expect it to be. It does exactly what I want it to and is helping me finish out college.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure he'll use it for fun too. So far he loves it
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my teenage son taking college classes so he can work on assignments wherever he needs to. Most schoolwork is done via a web portal, so to access Google Drive is the main objective for this little Chromebook. I'm sure he'll use it for fun too. So far he loves it, and is very happy with speed and size. Very portable.
customer_reviews.author: Uprivermama

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Gave to my 13 year old for Christmas. So far so good. She would have preferred a laptop with a disk drive, but the price was just too good on this. She seems happy and I think it will do everything she needs.
customer_reviews.author: 1tonysmom

customer_reviews.title: Great Laptop for Working Offline
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Small drive but with the cloud and a 128 GB drive it's awesome. Nothing but convenience. It was weird to get used to the offline. Once you learn how you want to work it's a breeze. It's great for writing.
customer_reviews.author: Bucky Barnes

customer_reviews.title: The Chromebook itself is great in weight and size
customer_reviews.text: The package came as expected at the right time. It was securely wrapped and without damage. The Chromebook itself is great in weight and size. It's pretty fast and runs well even with the 2GB ram version. Despite being so light, it feels sturdy enough that I'm not so worried about it being damaged when I carry it around and the hinge is nice and sturdy as well.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Garcia

customer_reviews.title: The thing I love most (and it's true of all Chromebooks
customer_reviews.text: The thing I love most (and it's true of all Chromebooks, really, not just this one) is how responsive and predictable the touchpad is, especially when combined with the gestures built into Chrome OS (e.g. swipe three fingers side to side to move between tabs). For me, this touchpad experience is the single greatest advantage over a similarly cheap but adequate laptop running Windows.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Denker

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard. I'm a writer and move pretty quickly ...
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard. I'm a writer and move pretty quickly on a keyboard, and this one is terrific. Really good speakers, great sound quality. Legit battery time of 10 hours. Trade-offs for these ++ features: average screen with very limited angular viewing, and sluggish with more than a couple of open tabs. If planned usage is simply email, shopping, and IM, it's decent value for an under $200 laptop. If it's all about the screen for you, or if you have multiple tabs open (for instance, Netflix/Hulu, and checking your email, and IM'ing, go with a different model and be sure it has 4GB ram.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Dissappointed
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been a terrible experience. I just bought this chromebook and in three days I have experienced crashes at least 10 times already. The computer just shuts off unexpectedly. I have chatted with google tech support they told me that they have not heard of this problem before and i should perform a hard reset. i did and it didn't work. I will seek more help if no change i will be sending this computer back. So disappointed
customer_reviews.author: LexiiCarter

customer_reviews.title: this Chromebook is fine. Even though the OS is based on online ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this Chromebook is fine. Even though the OS is based on online service, I can install Linux on the machine to use it as a Linux machine, which is much more capable than an iPad. It is slightly slow and the RAM could run out sometime. One other problem with this laptop is its weak touch pad. The physical left mouse button under the touch pad broke relatively fast on this product I have, but the capacitive touch pad sensor is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mingchen Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Worth it for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: If you are big on reviews like me, all the good factual and honest reviews are all accurate. Bought this for my high school kid a sophomore and he loves it. Enough for basic needs, runs fast, sleek features. So far no issues. And love that tech support makes themselves available.
customer_reviews.author: Leila Crouse

customer_reviews.title: downloading cootie filled crap and whatnot
customer_reviews.text: Use this around the house- streaming movies, downloading cootie filled crap and whatnot. It's our little tramp and it's doing very well. So cheap and easy to use. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kelly

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this chromebook for my daughter who is a ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chromebook for my daughter who is a senior in college. She absolutely loves it and uses it daily. It compliments her normal PC which is a Mac.
customer_reviews.author: Elliot israel

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight chromebook
customer_reviews.text: Very fast, very slick. Super long battery life. Sound quality is amazing. The only think that surprised me was the battery was totally discharged-- no big deal, plug it in.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for school
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a lightweight laptop to take to college classes, library, etc. I was a little nervous about such a low priced computer, but other reviews convinced me to try it. I love it! It's very fast, has amazing battery life, and weighs very little. Being strictly cloud-based does take a little getting used to if you've never used something like this, but once you see how to make use of the apps, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: T Davis

customer_reviews.title: Nice Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: This Chromebook is one of the better ones I have had. The keys are a little noisy and wobbly, or else I would give it the big 5 Stars.
customer_reviews.author: Hotwaterplug

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for kids!
customer_reviews.text: Who knew this thing is a great item for my kids. I even use it from time to time when I do not feel like being "stuck" stationary on my desktop. Will probably buy another.
customer_reviews.author: gumdrop

customer_reviews.title: Very entertaining
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my girlfriends birthday because she needed a new computer. To say the least she loves it! I told her its online only and she thought it would be terrible and then she got used to it and prefers it over other computers for entertainment features.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Brack

customer_reviews.title: Great if you know what your getting into
customer_reviews.text: Great for web surfing, google docs, and web development, but not much else. Stutters when too many tabs are open, or if two videos are being played. Fantastic build quality, battery life, and super lightweight. For what I use it for (note taking, browsing, web dev) it is a perfect lightweight solution, but for anyone requiring a machine to do it all, this is not it.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Zarnoch

customer_reviews.title: This laptop is a great price and very light weight
customer_reviews.text: I dont understand what all the negative reviews are about. This laptop is a great price and very light weight. Very fast!
customer_reviews.author: tmhairawy

customer_reviews.title: I bought this specifically for school. It has accommodated ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for school. It has accommodated what I need in Math but I'm still working on the Powerpoint clitches that are sorely needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jewell Wooten

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent
customer_reviews.text: Great device. My brother (who has two) talked me into it and I'm glad he did. Well worth the money (as long as you remember you need to be on wifi but I'm rarely someplace where I'm not so it's not an issue).
customer_reviews.author: Susan E.

customer_reviews.title: I am extremely pleased with the ASUS Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely pleased with the ASUS Chromebook. The apps included (both online and offline) meet all of my needs. The power on speed, lack of viruses and malware, automatic updates, light weight, and overall good looks are a real benefit. I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn R. Stringfield

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this for my 72 year aunt so she could ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 72 year aunt so she could browse online, email etc. she loves it and took her no time at all to learn how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the price. Perfect for our children to use for their schoolwork.
customer_reviews.author: Judith

customer_reviews.title: An excellent chromebook for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is my first chromebook. I have number of Windows laptops and desktop. The best thing I like about this chromebook is crystal clear picture, 7 seconds start time, 9 hours plus battery life and no sound of fan. I have been using for couple of days and it is fun to use. The reason I purchased this is to avoid virus and slow startups, and convenience. This is an excellent value for money. I have seen all the pros that come with a chromebook + excellent speed. The only Con is that Google didn't recognize this device and so I couldn't get 100 GB free cloud drive yet. I am working with them to get it.
customer_reviews.author: Sanjay

product_meta.title: ASUS Chromebook C200MA-DS01 11.6-Inch Laptop
product_meta.description:
ASUS 11.6" Chromebook, 2 GB RAM & 16 GB Storage (Black)

feature_bullets: 802.11 A/C wireless for incredibly fast networking (backwards compatible with all 802.11N, G, and/or B)
Intel Bay Trail N2830 2.16 GHz processor (turbos up to 2.41 GHz)
16 GB solid state storage. 11.6" HD LED display
1.2MP camera. 1x USB 3.0, 1x USB 2.0, 1x HDMI, SD Card slot (SDXC), Bluetooth 4.0.
